results.headline: The Joys of Retirement
results.summary_short: In “Mammuth,” Gérard Depardieu plays a French retiree who finds that no one much respects him, the work he’s done or the idea that he deserves a graceful retirement.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mammuth

results.headline: The Camera Doesn’t Lie, Does It?
results.summary_short: In “Archie’s Final Project,” the protagonist’s life is one big movie, with both comic and troubled sides, but the film’s message about teenage angst is completely serious.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Archie's Final Project

results.headline: The Healing Powers of a Friendship When Life’s Complications Strike
results.summary_short: In “50/50,” when Joseph Gordon-Levitt’s character receives a diagnosis of cancer, his pal, played by Seth Rogen, is there with support and leavening humor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 50/50

results.headline: A Blurry Look at the Child Prisoner of Guantánamo
results.summary_short: “You Don’t Like the Truth,” a documentary that uses declassified tapes, shows how a Canadian teenager held as a terrorist was interrogated at Guantánmo.
results.display_title: You Don't Like the Truth: 4 Days inside Guantanamo

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of You Don't Like the Truth: 4 Days inside Guantanamo

results.headline: Lost Baby Orca’s Rich Social Life
results.summary_short: “The Whale” is true adventure of Luna, a baby orca who made friends among the humans of Nootka Sound.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Saving Luna

results.headline: A Morning After That Turns Into a Dance of Discovery
results.summary_short: “Weekend,” directed by Andrew Haigh, is one of those rare films that address the complex entanglements of love and sex honestly.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Weekend

results.headline: From a School Band, Soul and Funk, and Heart
results.summary_short: “Thunder Soul” features a Houston high-school music director who turned his school’s band into a celebrated funk institution.

results.headline: Son Takes His Famous Father Out of the Shadows

results.headline: Throwing a Digital-Age Curveball
results.summary_short: Brad Pitt plays Billy Beane, the baseball executive who challenged traditions of the game, in “Moneyball.”

results.headline: ‘Billy Elliot’ by Way of Kitchen, With a Pinch of ‘Sweeney Todd’
results.summary_short: “Toast,” based on the memoir by the food writer Nigel Slater, tells the story of a young man obsessed with cooking.

results.summary_short: Taylor Lautner stars in “Abduction.” There is also a plot, of sorts.

results.summary_short: In “Puncture” Chris Evans plays a personal-injury lawyer and prodigious drug user who takes on the pharmaceutical industry.

results.summary_short: Cameron Crowe’s documentary about the band Pearl Jam honors its two-decade career.

results.headline: Good Works With a Bad Attitude
results.summary_short: A former drug dealer, Sam Childers underwent a religious conversion. But it may be that, in movie terms, Mr. Childers’s story is too true to be good.

results.headline: Rise and Fall of a Nightclub Impresario
results.summary_short: “Limelight” recounts the career of Peter Gatien, the Canadian entrepreneur who ruled New York City nightlife in the 1980s.

results.summary_short: Jason Statham and Robert De Niro portray elite mercenaries in “Killer Elite.”

results.summary_short: Morgan Freeman and Nathan Gamble star in “Dolphin Tale,” a film inspired by an actual dolphin rescue.

results.summary_short: “A Bird of the Air” is an offbeat romance fueled by pets and pithy aphorisms.

results.headline: This Cheating Couple Have a Lot in Common
